medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant abdominal pain for approximately one week.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports dull, constant, non-radiating pain that has been present for approximately one week. He is unsure whether it worsens with oral intake. He has had prior episodes of abdominal pain similar to his current symptoms, but it has never been this persistent. There has been no change in bowel habits.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) on prednisone and methotrexate, left lung nodule (reportedly biopsied and found to be benign), colonic polyps.
